ConfigManager package¶

Submodules¶

ConfigManager.ConfigManager module¶

Manage json configuration file(s)

exception ConfigManager.ConfigManager.ConfigLoadError¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Custom exception class!

Raised if there is any error in loading Configuration file

class ConfigManager.ConfigManager.ConfigManager¶

Bases: object

Singleton class to handle and load configuration from json to dictionary

Will read a json configuration file, and load it into a dictionary. These values will be then used as per need throughout the framework

  • val (str) – name of file
Returns:

absolute path of file
Return type:

str
ConfigManager.ManageJsonConfig.get_dict_value(dictionary, keys, ascii=False, default=None)¶

Get value from nested dictionary using deep fetch

Examples:
  • dictionary = {‘meta’: {‘status’: ‘OK’, ‘status_code’: 200}}
  • get_dict_value(dictionary, [“meta”, “status_code”]) # => 200
  • get_dict_value(dictionary, [“garbage”, “status_code”]) # => None
  • get_dict_value(dictionary, [“meta”, “garbage”], default=’-‘) # => ‘-‘
Parameters:
  • dictionary (dict) – dictionary to get value from
  • keys (list) – list of keys for nested dictionary values
  • ascii (bool) – specify if value has to returned as ascii
  • default (str) – return value if key not found. By default return None
Returns:

value from the dictionary
Return type:

str
ConfigManager.ManageJsonConfig.get_json_as_dictionary(json_file_path)¶

Parse json file and return as dictionary

Parameters:json_file_path (str) – path to json file
Returns:json as dictionary
Return type:dict
